definition:
at, within, or to a short distance or time                                      
             
             sunset was drawing near

almost, nearly                                      
             
             was near dead

in a close or intimate manner : closely                                      
             
             near related
in a frugal manner

close to                                      
             
             beaches near the city

not far distant in time, place, or degree                                      
             
             in the near future

almost happening : narrowly missed or avoided                                      
             
             a near win in the primary

nearly not happening                                      
             
             a near escape

closely related or intimately associated                                      
             
             her nearest and dearest friend

being the closer of two                                      
             
             the near side

being the left-hand one of a pair                                      
             
             the near wheel of a cart

direct, short                                      
             
             the nearest road
stingy, closefisted

closely resembling the standard or typical                                      
             
             a near desert

approximating the genuine                                      
             
             near silk
approach
close to someone or something in distance
not far away in time
almost or nearly
close to (something or someone)
located a short distance away
—used to refer to the side, end, etc., that is closer
to come closer in space or time to someone or something

at, within, or to a short distance or time                                      
             
             Don't go any nearer.

almost, nearly                                      
             
             The weather was near perfect.

close to                                      
             
             We'll take a table near the window.

closely related or associated                                      
             
             a near relative

not far away in distance or time                                      
             
             the nearest exit

coming close : narrow                                      
             
             a near miss

to come near : approach                                      
             
             As they neared the burrow Willie … came galloping toward them …

definition: close to someone or something
used for referring to the side of something that is the closest to where you are
getting close to a particular state or situation
not long before a particular time or event
very similar to something
only a little less than a particular amount or number
in: A group of students were standing near the entrance.
The tornado destroyed two houses near Tulsa.
The shops are quite near.
I slept in the bed nearest the door.
They live in a small cottage 15 miles from the nearest village.
near to: Rosa moved a little nearer to the fire.
I got into the near side of the bed.
near to: Julian was near to panic as he suddenly realized that he was trapped.
People near to retirement need to know their pension funds are sufficient.
near to doing something: They are near to solving the puzzle.
There were rumours that the 66-year-old leader was near death.
It was nearer three than two o’clock when he finally arrived.
I had no intention of making any decision until much nearer the time.
The incident occurred near the end of the war.
draw near: The date of the election was drawing near.
What he’s saying now is near the truth, but it’s still not accurate.
near to: My feelings were nearer to despair than disappointment.
The temperature that day was near 30 degrees.
The loss was near 15 per cent for the year.
damned/damn near
from near and far
in the near future
near enough
someone’s nearest and dearest
someone’s nearest rival/challenger
a near relative/relation
a near thing
not go near
nowhere/not anywhere near
so near (and) yet so far
to the nearest pound/thousand etc
the nearest thing to something

definition: 1. A preposition meaning close to or next to.2. A character from Death Note.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.

Near is an orphan who grew up at the Wammy's House orphanage. During his entire time at the orphanage he was competing with Mello to become L's successor. He was known to be very antisocial, as in the manga a fellow student (Linda) asked him to play outside and he declined.With Near's introverted-ness probably came loneliness, though Near seems to have next to no emotion. To deal, he plays with many childish toys, such as; toy robots, action figures and finger puppets. he also enjoys making elaborate card and dice towers. In the one-shot (Ch. 109) set three years after the Kira case, Near is seen to be surrounded by a enormous tarrot card tower that reaches the ceiling and spreads around the room.Speaking of which, in the one-shot Near is still seen playing with his finger puppets. Now, of course, he only has himself, L, and... Mello? Though Mello has no use being there, Near still keeps Mello's creepy little finger puppet. Is it so he can make his puppet and Mello's make out? No one can be certain. However, Near does show a deal of respect towards Mello and many suspect he had a crush on him. Poor guy.Near is hated by many, but I personally think that if you would only read the one-shot he would grow on you. Or you would just come to your senses and realize how adorable he is.Near lovers, unite!

A small, bright, albino~esque, toy obsessed boy and rival of Mello from the anime/maga series Death Note. Though only 5' tall.. And quite weak looking, he Defeated Kira and Succeded L. Looks can be decieving.
nearly, almost

A measurement.
10,000 gallons.
To get with a person whom you desire sexually, and perhaps also emotionally or spiritually, and do doggy style.
